description: Attested since the 1930s in the sense “chance to re-take a golf stroke”; probably from the name Mulligan, after a golfer who replayed a stroke. See Wikipedia for more information.

examples: "I've got a mulligan on the stove upstairs," grinned Sloan, getting out of his chair.

entries.meaning: (golf) An unpenalized chance to re-take a stroke that went awry.
examples: If you lose your drive in the water, take a mulligan and try again.

entries.meaning: (collectible card games) An opportunity (sometimes penalized) for a player to reshuffle their cards and draw a new initial hand at the beginning of a game.

examples: Don't do poorly in your first interview; you won't get a mulligan.
